metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: ICT governance framework and policies
clauses.rationale: Comprehensive coverage via policy controls across all families (AC-01, AT-01, AU-01, CA-01, CM-01, CP-01, IA-01, IR-01, MA-01, MP-01, PE-01, PL-01, PL-02, PL-06, PS-01, RA-01, SA-01, SA-02, SC-01, SI-01, SR-01) plus CA-06 authorization and PL-03 plan update.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires Swiss-specific governance with board-level accountability for ICT strategy. SP 800-53 covers comprehensive policy framework but not Swiss regulatory board oversight requirements or FINMA-specific governance reporting.

clauses.title: ICT strategy alignment with business strategy
clauses.rationale: AC-01 and CA-01 policy; CA-06 authorization; PL-01/PL-02/PL-06 planning; SA-02 resource allocation.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires ICT strategy to be approved by senior management and aligned with business strategy. SP 800-53 covers security planning and resource allocation but not Swiss-specific ICT strategy alignment with business objectives.

clauses.title: ICT strategy documentation and updates
clauses.rationale: PL-02 system security plan; PL-03 plan update; SA-02 resource allocation.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires regular ICT strategy review and update cycles with documented approval. SP 800-53 covers plan documentation and updates but not FINMA-specific strategy review cadence.

clauses.title: ICT infrastructure management and operations
clauses.rationale: Extensive coverage via AU-04/AU-08 audit infrastructure; CM-01/CM-02/CM-06/CM-07/CM-08 configuration management; CP-08 telecommunications; MA family maintenance; PE family physical protection; SA-03/SA-05/SA-06/SA-08 system acquisition; SC-06/SC-20/SC-21/SC-22 network services.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINMA-specific requirements for Swiss financial institution ICT infrastructure standards. SP 800-53 provides comprehensive technical infrastructure controls.

clauses.title: ICT capacity and performance management
clauses.rationale: AU-04 audit storage capacity; CM-02/CM-06/CM-08 configuration management; MA-02/MA-03/MA-06 maintenance; SA-08 security engineering; SC-06 resource priority.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific capacity planning and performance monitoring for financial services. SP 800-53 covers capacity and performance through multiple controls but not financial sector-specific SLA requirements.

clauses.title: ICT asset inventory
clauses.rationale: CM-02 baseline configuration; CM-08 component inventory. Strong asset inventory coverage.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINMA requires comprehensive ICT asset inventory. SP 800-53 CM-08 provides thorough component inventory capability.

clauses.title: ICT architecture documentation
clauses.rationale: CM-02 baseline configuration. Covers system baseline documentation.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires documented ICT architecture including network diagrams and system interconnections. SP 800-53 CM-02 covers baseline configuration but FINMA expects more comprehensive architectural documentation.

clauses.title: ICT change management framework
clauses.rationale: CM-01 configuration management policy; CM-03/CM-04/CM-05 change control; MA-01/MA-02 maintenance policy; SA-01/SA-03/SA-05/SA-06/SA-07/SA-10/SA-11 acquisition and development lifecycle; SI-02 flaw remediation.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive change management through CM and SA families.

clauses.title: Change control process and testing
clauses.rationale: CM-03/CM-04/CM-05 change control and monitoring; SA-03 lifecycle support; SA-10 developer configuration management; SA-11 developer security testing.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINMA requires formal testing and approval processes for changes. SP 800-53 CM and SA families cover this comprehensively.

clauses.title: Change impact analysis
clauses.rationale: CM-03 configuration change control; CM-04 monitoring configuration changes; SA-10 developer configuration management.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINMA requires documented change impact analysis. SP 800-53 CM-03 and CM-04 cover change analysis and monitoring.

clauses.title: Change approval and documentation
clauses.rationale: CM-03 configuration change control; SA-10 developer configuration management.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINMA requires formal change approval with documentation. SP 800-53 CM-03 provides change control with approval mechanisms.

clauses.title: Emergency change procedures
clauses.rationale: CM-03 configuration change control including emergency changes.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific emergency change procedures with retrospective approval. SP 800-53 CM-03 covers emergency changes but FINMA-specific financial sector urgency protocols need supplementation.

clauses.title: Incident management framework
clauses.rationale: AU-05 audit processing failures; IR-01 through IR-05/IR-07 incident response family; SI-11 error handling.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires Swiss financial sector incident management aligned with FINMA reporting requirements. SP 800-53 IR family provides strong incident management but not FINMA-specific escalation and reporting timelines.

clauses.title: Incident classification and prioritisation
clauses.rationale: IR-02 incident response training; IR-04 incident handling with classification.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific incident classification for financial services including severity levels aligned with regulatory thresholds. SP 800-53 covers incident handling but not FINMA-specific classification criteria.

clauses.title: Incident response and escalation
clauses.rationale: IR-04 incident handling including containment, eradication, and recovery.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific escalation paths to senior management and board. SP 800-53 IR-04 covers incident handling but FINMA-specific escalation to Swiss governance structures needs supplementation.

clauses.title: Incident monitoring and tracking
clauses.rationale: IR-05 incident monitoring; IR-06 incident reporting.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 IR-05 and IR-06 cover incident monitoring and reporting well.

clauses.title: Incident reporting to FINMA
clauses.rationale: IR-06 incident reporting. General reporting framework applies.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific incident reporting to FINMA within defined timeframes for material ICT incidents. SP 800-53 IR-06 covers incident reporting but FINMA-specific reporting timelines, formats, and thresholds are regulatory requirements not addressed.

clauses.title: Incident notification to affected parties
clauses.rationale: IR-06 incident reporting.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires notification of affected clients and counterparties. SP 800-53 IR-06 covers reporting but not Swiss financial sector client notification requirements.

clauses.title: Incident lessons learned
clauses.rationale: IR-06 incident reporting. Post-incident review covered implicitly.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires formal lessons learned process and documented improvements. SP 800-53 IR-06 covers reporting but post-incident review and improvement processes are less explicitly defined.

clauses.title: ICT personnel and security awareness framework
clauses.rationale: AT-01 through AT-05 awareness and training family; PL-01/PL-02/PL-04/PL-06 planning; PS-01/PS-02/PS-03/PS-06/PS-08 personnel security; RA-01 risk assessment policy.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINMA requires Swiss financial sector-specific personnel security. SP 800-53 provides comprehensive personnel and training controls.

clauses.title: ICT security training programme
clauses.rationale: AT-01 training policy; AT-02 security awareness; AT-03 security training; AT-04 training records; PL-04 rules of behaviour.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINMA requires role-based training specific to financial services. SP 800-53 AT family covers training comprehensively.

clauses.title: Security awareness for all staff
clauses.rationale: AT-02 security awareness; AT-03 security training. Strong awareness coverage.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 AT-02 and AT-03 provide comprehensive security awareness and training.

clauses.title: Ongoing security awareness updates
clauses.rationale: AT-02 security awareness with ongoing updates.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 AT-02 covers ongoing awareness. FINMA expects regular refresh aligned with evolving threats to financial sector.

clauses.title: Threat intelligence and information sharing
clauses.rationale: AT-05 contacts with security groups and associations; SI-05 security alerts and advisories.
clauses.gaps: FINMA encourages participation in financial sector threat intelligence sharing. SP 800-53 AT-05 and SI-05 cover external contacts and alerts but not Swiss-specific financial sector ISAC participation.

clauses.title: External threat intelligence sources
clauses.rationale: AT-05 contacts with security groups; SI-05 security alerts and advisories.
clauses.gaps: FINMA expects use of financial sector-specific threat intelligence. SP 800-53 covers external threat sources but not Swiss financial sector-specific intelligence feeds.

clauses.title: ICT risk assessment framework
clauses.rationale: CA-05 POA&M; CM-08 component inventory; PS-02 position categorisation; RA-01 through RA-05 risk assessment family.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires ICT risk assessment aligned with Swiss financial regulatory expectations. SP 800-53 RA family provides comprehensive risk assessment; gap in FINMA-specific risk categories and financial materiality thresholds.

clauses.title: ICT risk identification and analysis
clauses.rationale: CA-05 POA&M; CM-08 inventory; RA-02 categorisation; RA-03 risk assessment; RA-04 risk assessment update.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 RA family covers risk identification and analysis. FINMA-specific financial risk categories may require supplementation.

clauses.title: Vulnerability management
clauses.rationale: RA-03 risk assessment; RA-05 vulnerability scanning; SI-02 flaw remediation; SI-05 security alerts.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive vulnerability management through RA-05 and SI-02.

clauses.title: Vulnerability scanning and assessment
clauses.rationale: RA-03 risk assessment; RA-05 vulnerability scanning.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 RA-05 provides strong vulnerability scanning capability.

clauses.title: Risk assessment documentation and review
clauses.rationale: RA-03 risk assessment with documentation requirements.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 RA-03 covers risk assessment documentation. FINMA expects regular review cycles aligned with regulatory calendar.

clauses.title: Access control and security controls framework
clauses.rationale: Extensive coverage via AC family (AC-01 through AC-20); AU-09 audit protection; CM-05 change access restrictions; IA family (IA-01 through IA-07) identification and authentication; MA-04 remote maintenance; MP-02 media access; PE-02/PE-03 physical access; PS-04/PS-05/PS-06 personnel termination/transfer/agreements; SA-08 security engineering; SC family (SC-01/SC-05/SC-07/SC-10/SC-11/SC-14/SC-15/SC-18/SC-23) communications protection; SI family (SI-01/SI-02/SI-03/SI-07/SI-08) system integrity.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive access control and security. Very strong alignment with FINMA requirements.

clauses.title: Identity and access management
clauses.rationale: AC-01/AC-02/AC-03/AC-05/AC-06/AC-13 access control; IA-01/IA-02/IA-04/IA-05 identification and authentication; PS-04/PS-05 personnel termination and transfer.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive identity and access management controls.

clauses.title: Authentication and session management
clauses.rationale: AC-02/AC-03/AC-06/AC-07/AC-10/AC-11/AC-12 access control; IA-02/IA-05 authentication; SC-10 network disconnect.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides strong authentication and session management.

clauses.title: Network security and segmentation
clauses.rationale: AC-04/AC-17/AC-18 information flow and remote/wireless access; CA-03 system connections; IA-03 device authentication; MA-04 remote maintenance; PE-04 transmission medium; SC-02/SC-03/SC-05/SC-07/SC-14/SC-15/SC-19/SC-20/SC-21/SC-22 network protection.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive network security controls. FINMA-specific Swiss financial network segmentation standards well addressed.

clauses.title: Cryptography and data protection in transit
clauses.rationale: AC-04/AC-17 information flow; IA-07 cryptographic module authentication; MP-05 media transport; PE-19 information leakage; SC-02/SC-03/SC-07/SC-08/SC-09/SC-11/SC-12/SC-13/SC-16/SC-17/SC-19/SC-23 comprehensive cryptographic and communications protection.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive cryptographic controls. Very strong alignment with FINMA cryptography requirements.

clauses.title: Endpoint and software security
clauses.rationale: AC-19 mobile device access; CM-06/CM-07 configuration and least functionality; SA-07 user-installed software; SC-12/SC-13/SC-17/SC-18 cryptographic and mobile code; SI-02/SI-03/SI-07/SI-08 flaw remediation, malware protection, software integrity.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive endpoint protection. FINMA-specific endpoint standards well addressed.

clauses.title: Malware protection
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality; SC-05 denial of service protection; SI-03 malicious code protection.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 SI-03 provides comprehensive malware protection.

clauses.title: Logging and monitoring framework
clauses.rationale: AU-01 through AU-11 audit family; CA-07 continuous monitoring; CM-04 monitoring; IR-05 incident monitoring; PE-06/PE-08 physical monitoring; SI-01/SI-04/SI-11 system monitoring and error handling.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 AU and SI families provide comprehensive logging and monitoring. Very strong alignment.

clauses.title: Security event logging
clauses.rationale: AU-01/AU-02/AU-03/AU-05/AU-06/AU-07/AU-09/AU-10 audit family; CA-07 continuous monitoring; IR-05 incident monitoring; SI-04 system monitoring.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 AU family provides comprehensive security event logging.

clauses.title: Log analysis and correlation
clauses.rationale: AU-02 auditable events; AU-06 audit review and analysis; CA-07 continuous monitoring; SI-04 system monitoring.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 AU-06 and SI-04 cover log analysis and correlation. FINMA expects financial sector-specific SIEM requirements.

clauses.title: Automated monitoring and alerting
clauses.rationale: AU-06 audit monitoring, analysis, and reporting; SI-04 system monitoring tools and techniques.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 AU-06 and SI-04 provide automated monitoring and alerting capabilities.

clauses.title: Cyber incident response framework
clauses.rationale: CP-10 system recovery; IR-01/IR-02 incident response policy and training; IR-04 incident handling; IR-07 incident response assistance.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires Swiss financial sector cyber incident response aligned with FINMA reporting obligations. SP 800-53 IR family provides strong incident response but not FINMA-specific cyber response requirements.

clauses.title: Cyber incident containment and recovery
clauses.rationale: CP-10 system recovery; IR-02 training; IR-04 incident handling; IR-07 assistance.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific containment and recovery procedures for financial system cyber incidents. SP 800-53 covers containment and recovery but FINMA-specific financial service continuity requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Cyber incident eradication
clauses.rationale: CP-10 system recovery; IR-04 incident handling including eradication.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires thorough eradication verification before system restoration. SP 800-53 covers eradication but FINMA-specific verification requirements for financial systems need supplementation.

clauses.title: Cyber incident reporting to FINMA
clauses.rationale: IR-06 incident reporting.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific cyber incident reporting to FINMA within defined timeframes. SP 800-53 IR-06 covers incident reporting but FINMA-specific timelines and reporting formats are Swiss regulatory requirements not addressed.

clauses.title: Cyber incident notification to clients
clauses.rationale: IR-06 incident reporting.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires client notification for material cyber incidents affecting financial services. SP 800-53 IR-06 covers reporting but not Swiss financial sector client notification requirements.

clauses.title: Security testing framework
clauses.rationale: CA-01 assessment policy; CA-02 security assessments; CA-04 security certification; CA-05 POA&M; CA-06 authorization; CA-07 continuous monitoring; IR-03 incident response testing; RA-05 vulnerability scanning; SA-11 developer security testing; SI-06 security functionality verification.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive security testing through CA, RA, and SA families.

clauses.title: Penetration testing and vulnerability assessment
clauses.rationale: CA-02 security assessments; CA-04 certification; CA-07 continuous monitoring; IR-03 incident response testing; RA-05 vulnerability scanning; SA-11 developer testing; SI-06 security verification.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINMA requires regular penetration testing. SP 800-53 RA-05 and CA-02 provide strong vulnerability assessment and testing. FINMA-specific TLPT (threat-led penetration testing) requirements may need supplementation.

clauses.title: Independent security testing
clauses.rationale: CA-02 security assessments; IR-03 incident response testing.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires periodic independent security testing by qualified third parties. SP 800-53 CA-02 supports independent assessment but FINMA-specific independent testing cadence and qualifications require supplementation.

clauses.title: Data classification and protection framework
clauses.rationale: AC-15/AC-16 automated marking and labelling; MP-01 through MP-06 media protection; PE-19 information leakage; PL-05 privacy impact; PT-01 through PT-07 PII processing; RA-02 security categorisation; SC-01/SC-04/SC-08/SC-09 communications protection; SI-07/SI-09/SI-10/SI-12 system integrity.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive data classification and protection. FINMA Swiss banking secrecy and client data protection requirements may need supplementation.

clauses.title: Data classification scheme
clauses.rationale: AC-15/AC-16 automated marking/labelling; MP-01/MP-03 media protection and labelling; PL-05 privacy impact; PT-01/PT-02/PT-03/PT-07 PII processing.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires data classification aligned with Swiss banking secrecy requirements. SP 800-53 covers security classification but Swiss-specific banking data classification needs supplementation.

clauses.title: Data handling and processing controls
clauses.rationale: AC-16 automated labelling; MP-02/MP-03 media access and labelling; PT-03/PT-07 PII processing purposes and categories; SI-09/SI-10 input restrictions and accuracy.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific data handling procedures for Swiss financial data. SP 800-53 covers data handling but Swiss banking secrecy and data locality requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Data protection in storage and transit
clauses.rationale: MP-04/MP-05 media storage and transport; PE-18 component location; SC-08/SC-09 transmission integrity and confidentiality.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides strong data protection in storage and transit.

clauses.title: Data retention and archiving
clauses.rationale: AU-11 audit record retention; CP-09 backup; MP-04 media storage; PT-06 system of records; SI-12 information output handling and retention.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires data retention aligned with Swiss financial regulatory requirements (typically 10 years). SP 800-53 covers retention but Swiss-specific financial regulatory retention periods need supplementation.

clauses.title: Secure data disposal
clauses.rationale: AU-11 audit retention; MP-06 media sanitisation; SC-04 information remnance; SI-12 information output handling; SR-12 component disposal.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive data disposal through MP-06, SC-04, and SR-12.

clauses.title: Data quality and accuracy
clauses.rationale: MP-06 media sanitisation; SI-10 information accuracy, completeness, validity.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires data quality controls for financial data accuracy. SP 800-53 SI-10 covers input validation but FINMA-specific financial data quality requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: ICT business continuity management framework
clauses.rationale: CP-01 contingency planning policy; CP-02 contingency plan; CP-05 contingency plan update.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires comprehensive ICT BCM aligned with Swiss financial sector operational resilience requirements. SP 800-53 CP family covers contingency planning but FINMA-specific BCM framework and Swiss financial sector resilience requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Business impact analysis for ICT
clauses.rationale: CP-01 contingency planning policy; CP-02 contingency plan with business impact analysis.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires BIA specific to financial services with recovery time and recovery point objectives. SP 800-53 CP-02 includes BIA but FINMA-specific financial sector impact criteria need supplementation.

clauses.title: ICT recovery capabilities
clauses.rationale: CP-02 contingency plan; CP-06 alternate storage; CP-07 alternate processing; CP-08 telecommunications; CP-09 backup; CP-10 recovery; MA-06 timely maintenance; PE-09 through PE-15 physical environmental protection; PE-17 alternate work site.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 provides comprehensive recovery capabilities through the CP and PE families.

clauses.title: ICT disaster recovery planning
clauses.rationale: CP-02 contingency plan; CP-06/CP-07/CP-08/CP-09/CP-10 recovery infrastructure; PE-17 alternate work site.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 covers disaster recovery planning. FINMA-specific Swiss financial sector DR requirements largely addressed.

clauses.title: Recovery site and backup requirements
clauses.rationale: CP-02 contingency plan; CP-06 alternate storage; CP-07 alternate processing; CP-09 backup.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 covers alternate sites and backup. FINMA may have Swiss data residency requirements for recovery sites.

clauses.title: Business continuity training
clauses.rationale: CP-03 contingency training.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 CP-03 covers contingency training.

clauses.title: Business continuity awareness
clauses.rationale: CP-03 contingency training.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 CP-03 covers contingency awareness and training.

clauses.title: Business continuity testing framework
clauses.rationale: CP-04 contingency plan testing and exercises.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 CP-04 provides comprehensive BC testing. FINMA may require specific financial sector scenario testing.

clauses.title: Disaster recovery testing
clauses.rationale: CP-04 contingency plan testing and exercises.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 CP-04 covers DR testing.

clauses.title: Business continuity testing scenarios
clauses.rationale: CP-04 contingency plan testing including realistic scenarios.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires severe but plausible scenario testing for financial services. SP 800-53 CP-04 covers testing but FINMA-specific financial sector scenario requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Business continuity test results and improvements
clauses.rationale: CP-04 contingency plan testing with lessons learned.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires documented test results and improvement actions. SP 800-53 CP-04 covers testing results but FINMA-specific improvement documentation requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Business continuity plan maintenance
clauses.rationale: CP-05 contingency plan update.
clauses.gaps: Minor: SP 800-53 CP-05 covers contingency plan maintenance and updates.

clauses.title: Business continuity plan distribution
clauses.rationale: CP-05 contingency plan update including distribution.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires plan distribution to key personnel. SP 800-53 CP-05 covers plan updates but specific distribution requirements less detailed.

clauses.title: Outsourcing governance framework
clauses.rationale: AC-20 external systems; CA-03 system connections; MA-05 maintenance personnel; PS-03/PS-07 personnel screening and third-party security; SA-01/SA-04 acquisition policy and requirements; SA-09 external services; SR-01/SR-02/SR-05 supply chain management.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires comprehensive outsourcing governance including Swiss-specific regulatory approval requirements for material outsourcing. SP 800-53 covers vendor management but FINMA-specific outsourcing governance and FINMA notification requirements not addressed.

clauses.title: Outsourcing risk assessment
clauses.rationale: AC-20 external systems; CA-03 system connections; MA-05 maintenance personnel; PS-07 third-party personnel; SA-04 acquisitions; SA-09 external services; SR-01/SR-02/SR-05 supply chain.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific risk assessment for outsourcing arrangements including concentration risk and Swiss-specific regulatory considerations. SP 800-53 covers third-party risk assessment but FINMA-specific outsourcing risk criteria need supplementation.

clauses.title: Outsourcing contractual requirements
clauses.rationale: PS-07 third-party personnel security; SA-04 acquisitions; SA-09 external services; SR-02 supply chain risk management plan.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific contractual clauses including FINMA audit rights, sub-outsourcing restrictions, and data location requirements. SP 800-53 covers vendor contracts but FINMA-specific contractual requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Outsourcing due diligence
clauses.rationale: SA-04 acquisitions; SA-09 external services; SR-02 supply chain plan.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific due diligence for outsourcing partners including financial stability and Swiss regulatory compliance. SP 800-53 covers vendor assessment but FINMA-specific due diligence requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Outsourcing ongoing monitoring
clauses.rationale: SA-09 external services; SR-03 supply chain controls.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires ongoing monitoring of outsourcing providers including SLA monitoring and Swiss regulatory compliance tracking. SP 800-53 covers external service monitoring but FINMA-specific ongoing monitoring requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Sub-outsourcing controls

clauses.gaps: FINMA requires specific controls for sub-outsourcing including approval requirements and chain monitoring. SP 800-53 SR-03 covers supply chain processes but FINMA-specific sub-outsourcing governance not addressed.

clauses.gaps: FINMA requires notification and approval for material sub-outsourcing arrangements. SP 800-53 covers supply chain processes but not FINMA-specific sub-outsourcing approval requirements.

clauses.title: Sub-outsourcing risk management
clauses.rationale: SR-03 supply chain controls.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires risk management for the entire outsourcing chain. SP 800-53 SR-03 covers supply chain controls but FINMA-specific multi-tier outsourcing risk management needs supplementation.

clauses.title: Sub-outsourcing audit rights
clauses.rationale: SR-03 supply chain controls.
clauses.gaps: FINMA requires audit rights over sub-outsourcing arrangements. SP 800-53 covers supply chain verification but FINMA-specific audit rights for outsourcing chains not explicitly addressed.

clauses.title: Supply chain provenance

clauses.gaps: FINMA requires understanding of ICT supply chain provenance. SP 800-53 SR-04 covers provenance but FINMA-specific financial sector supply chain traceability may need supplementation.

clauses.title: Supply chain provenance verification
